body:
Can we change the way CI Job's are labeled so that the Spec name/version/hash are featured more prominently? 

Jobs are currently labeled like this:
* `(specs) autoconf/cyewtpk 2.69 intel@19.1.1.217 cray-cnl7-haswell`

GitLab only shows the first 13 characters of this by default, and you have to mouse-over to see the full label. So `(specs)` takes up 7/13 (>50%) of the label, when it is arguably the least important aspect of the label. This leads to all the job labels rendering as:
* `(specs) autoco` (you have to mouse over to see the whole label)

If we just move the `(specs)` designator to the end of the job, like this: 
* `autoconf/cyewtpk 2.69 intel@19.1.1.217 cray-cnl7-haswell (specs)`

The jobs are shortened in a way that preserves the more relevant portions of the label:
* `autoconf/cyew`

@scottwittenburg
title: Pipelines: Feature Spec Name more Prominently in CI Job Labels
